bioghist.p: Helen Hill Miller (1899-1995) was a 1921 graduate of Bryn Mawr College. She received her Ph.D. from the University of Chicago in 1928. She tutored at the Bryn Mawr Summer School for Women Workers in Industry in 1921, 1923 and 1926. She worked as a staff writer for the U.S. Department of Agriculture in the late 1930s, then as a correspondent for The Economist and Newsweek. She was a contributing editor to The New Republic and a writer for Harper's and Esquire.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of corrected proofs for Miller's Realms of Arthur (1966) and records related to a Smithsonian study tour of King Arthur's England (1972). Book materials include galleys, slides and photographs for the book's illustrations, bibliographies, the book contract, and some correspondence. Materials for the study tour include Miller's preparatory notes, itineraries, suggested reading lists, and post-tour correspondence.
